item.title: Black Bean Burger Binder
item.description: ðŸ§‚ Black Bean Burger Binder Use tortilla chip crumbs as a binder in black bean burgers. Adds crunch, salt, and a subtle corn flavor.

item.title: Breakfast Burrito Filler
item.description: Breakfast Burrito Filler Mix chip crumbs with eggs, beans, and cheese inside a tortilla for a crunchy breakfast burrito. Adds flavor and structure.

item.title: Casserole Topping
item.description: ðŸ§‚ Casserole Topping Use chip crumbs as a crunchy topping for casserolesâ€”enchilada bake, mac & cheese, or veggie layers.

item.title: Cheese Log Crust
item.description: ðŸ§€ Cheese Log Crust Roll a soft cheese log (like goat cheese or cream cheese blend) in tortilla chip crumbs. Adds crunch and flavor.

item.title: Cheesy Chip Balls
item.description: Cheesy Chip Balls Combine chip crumbs with cream cheese, shredded cheddar, and spices.

item.title: Chili Base Layer
item.description: ðŸ§‚ Chili Base Layer Sprinkle chip crumbs at the bottom of your bowl before adding chili. They soak up flavor and add texture as you eat.

item.title: Chip-Crusted Avocado Fries
item.description: Chip-Crusted Avocado Fries Coat avocado slices in chip crumbs and bake or air fry. Serve with salsa, sour cream, or chipotle mayo.

item.title: Crust for Chicken or Fish
item.description: Crust for Chicken or Fish Crush tortilla chips finely and use as a coating for fried or baked chicken tenders, fish fillets, or tofu.

item.title: Egg Scramble Crunch
item.description: Egg Scramble Crunch Toss chip crumbs into scrambled eggs or omelets for a salty kick and added texture. Great with jalapeÃ±os or salsa.

item.title: How to Check for Rancid Chips
item.description: ðŸ§ª How to Check for Rancid Chips Rancid chips are not just staleâ€”theyâ€™ve undergone fat oxidation and may be unsafe to eat.
